snippet: The profitability of today’s giant cruise ships depends on a tightly choreographed routine that’s part Nascar pit stop, part Noah’s Ark.
abstract: Profitability of cruise industry depends heavily on keeping ships at sea as often as possible; dynamic has resulted in remarkable 'turnaround' days in which ships offload thousands of passengers, take on new supplies and welcome thousands more, sometimes in as little as 12 hours; trade group expects industry to grow again in 2014 following lukewarm performance in wake of Costa Concordia tragedy.
lead_paragraph: The profitability of today’s giant cruise ships depends on a tightly choreographed routine that’s part Nascar pit stop, part Noah’s Ark.

headline.main: A Luxury Liner Docks, and the Countdown’s On
